intro: Sturmia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian sturmia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
